Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Upgrade project to .NET 9 and fix compatibility issues

This commit upgrades the CSharpener project from .NET 8 to .NET 9 and resolves
compatibility issues encountered during the migration.

Changes:
- Upgraded all project files to target net9.0
- Updated NuGet packages to .NET 9 compatible versions:
  * Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Workspaces: 4.8.0 â†’ 4.12.0
  * Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces.MSBuild: Added at 4.12.0
  * Microsoft.Build.Locator: 1.6.10 â†’ 1.7.8
  * System.Text.Json: 8.0.0 â†’ 9.0.0
  * Test packages updated to latest versions

Code fixes for .NET 9 compatibility:
- Fixed JavaScript template literals in HtmlOutput.cs (CS1002, CS1056, CS1010)
  * Replaced backtick template literals with string concatenation
  * .NET 9 has stricter verbatim string literal parsing
- Added missing using statements (Models namespace)
- Fixed method calls (LoadAsync vs LoadSolutionAsync)
- Fixed CallGraphBuilder constructor call
- Fixed cache parameter types (List<string> vs List<Compilation>)
- Excluded TestData files from test project compilation
- Disabled ImplicitUsings in SimpleConsoleApp to avoid entry point conflicts

Documentation:
- Added self-analysis HTML documentation (338KB)
- All tests pass (4/4 successful)
